[Home](./index.md) &gt; [@thi.ng/geom-api](./geom-api.md) &gt; [SubdivKernel](./geom-api.subdivkernel.md)

## SubdivKernel interface

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export interface SubdivKernel 
```

## Properties

|  Property | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  [fn](./geom-api.subdivkernel.fn.md) | <code>(pts: ReadonlyVec[], i: number, nump: number) =&gt; Vec[]</code> | Subdivision function. Called with an array of <code>size</code> consecutive points of the original curve and can produce any number of result points. Additionally is passed the index <code>i</code> of the processed point and <code>nump</code>, the total number of point in the curve/polyline. The latter 2 args are useful to implement custom behaviors for the start / end points of the curve. |
|  [pre](./geom-api.subdivkernel.pre.md) | <code>(pts: ReadonlyVec[]) =&gt; Iterable&lt;ReadonlyVec&gt;</code> | Optional function to pre-process the original curve points prior to each subdivision iteration and MUST yield an iterable of points (e.g. for closed curves / polygons to prepend the last point before the first). If omitted, the curve points are processed as is. |
|  [size](./geom-api.subdivkernel.size.md) | <code>number</code> | Kernal size. The subdivision function <code>fn</code> always receives <code>size</code> number consecutive points. |
